extendedIngredients.name: fennel bulbs
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 medium fennel bulbs, trimmed, halved, thinly sliced crosswise (about 3 1/2 cups)

extendedIngredients.name: oil packed sun dried tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup sliced oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, 2 tablespoons oil reserved

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/3 pounds uncooked large shrimp, peeled, deveined, tails left intact

recipes.title: Shrimp with Fennel, Dill, and Feta

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Tiamo Pinot Grigio. It has 4.2 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 8 dollars.

productMatches.title: Tiamo Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Light straw yellow color. Fresh and rich fruity aromas of apple and pear with a hint of citrus fruit that fade into the floral bouquet. Fresh and fruity, very clean and crisp.Tiamo Pinot Grigio pairs well with a wide array of lighter cuisine, especially fish/shellfish, poultry, pastas in cream sauce and softer cheeses. It's also an ideal aperitif.

recipes.instructions: Preparation                                                        Heat 2 tablespoons oil from sun-dried tomatoes in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add fennel; sauté 3 minutes. Add sun-dried tomatoes and garlic and stir 1 minute. Sprinkle shrimp with salt and pepper. Add shrimp to skillet and cook until just opaque in center, about 1 minute per side. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with dill, then feta.

steps.step: Heat 2 tablespoons oil from sun-dried tomatoes in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add sun-dried tomatoes and garlic and stir 1 minute. Sprinkle shrimp with salt and pepper.
Add shrimp to skillet and cook until just opaque in center, about 1 minute per side. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with dill, then feta.
